revised_title: Spontaneous Crystallization of Monochloracetic Acid and Naphthalene Mixtures
tldr: The authors investigate the spontaneous crystallization of monochloracetic acid and naphthalene mixtures, discovering that the mixtures do not form homogenous mixed crystals with a minimum freezing point. Instead, they find that the different modifications of monochloracetic acid have distinct temperatures of spontaneous crystallization when dissolved in naphthalene.
